resource_data:
<expression xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0 http://fire.eun.org/lode/imslorsltitm_v1p0.xsd" xmlns="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
  <identifier>
    <catalog>hdl</catalog>
    <entry>10494/106062</entry>
  </identifier>
  <identifier>
    <catalog>expression-cmr-id</catalog>
    <entry>106062</entry>
  </identifier>
  <description>
    <facet>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.expressionDescriptionFacetValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>main</value>
    </facet>
    <metadata>
      <schema>http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM</schema>
      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1770205958</entry>
          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="en">Stand Up And Sing: Arts And Our Reform History</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Stehen Sie Oben Und Singen Sie: Künste Und 
Unsere Verbesserung-Geschichte</string>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Levez-vous et Chantez : Arts et Notre 
Histoire de Réforme</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Esteja Acima E Cante: Artes E Nosso History 
Da Reforma</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Levisi in piedi In su E Canti: Arti E La 
Nostra Storia Di Riforma</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Η στάση επάνω και τραγουδά: Τέχνες και η 
ιστορία μεταρρύθμισής μας</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Esté parado Para arriba Y Cante: Artes Y 
Nuestra Historia De la Reforma</string>
          </title>
          <description>
            <string language="en">A lesson in which students (Grades 7-12) analyze lyrics and images of popular sheet music as part of their studies of the political, social, and economic conditions existing during industrialization and reform in the U.S.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">Arts</string>
          </keyword>
          <language>en</language>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Eine Lektion, in der Kursteilnehmer (Grade 7-12) 
Lyriken und Bilder der populären Blattmusik als Teil ihrer 
Studien der politischen, Sozial- und Wirtschaftslage analysieren, die 
während der Industrialisierung und der Verbesserung in den US 
existiert.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Une leçon dans laquelle les étudiants 
(catégories 7-12) analysent le lyrique et les images de la musique 
populaire de feuille en tant qu'élément de leurs études des 
conditions politiques, sociales, et économiques existant pendant 
l'industrialisation et la réforme aux États-Unis.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Uma lição em que os estudantes (classes 7-12) 
analisam lyrics e imagens da música popular da folha como a parte de 
seus estudos das circunstâncias políticas, sociais, e econômicas 
que existem durante o industrialization e a reforma nos E. U..</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Una lezione in cui gli allievi (gradi 7-12) 
analizzano i lyrics e le immagini di musica popolare del foglio come 
componente dei loro studi sulle circostanze politiche, sociali ed 
economiche che esistono durante l'industrializzazione e la riforma 
negli Stati Uniti.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Ένα μάθημα στο οποίο οι σπουδαστές (βαθμοί 7-12) 
αναλύουν τα λυρικά ποιήματα και τις εικόνες της δημοφιλούς 
μουσικής φύλλων ως τμήμα των μελετών τους των πολιτικών, 
κοινωνικών, και οικονομικών όρων που υπάρχουν κατά τη διάρκεια 
της εκβιομηχάνισης και της μεταρρύθμισης στις ΗΠΑ</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Una lección en la cual los estudiantes (grados 
7-12) analizan las líricas y las imágenes de la música popular de 
la hoja como parte de sus estudios de las condiciones políticas, 
sociales, y económicas que existen durante la industrialización y la
reforma en los E.E.U.U..</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Künste</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Arts</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Artes</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Arti</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Τέχνες</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Artes</string>
          </keyword>
        </general>
        <metaMetadata>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1770205958</entry>
          </identifier>
          <language>en</language>
        </metaMetadata>
        <educational>
          <language>en</language>
        </educational>
        <rights>
          <copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>
            <source>copyrightAndOtherRestrictionsValues</source>
            <value>yes</value>
          </copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>
          <description>
            <string language="en">Custom License</string>
          </description>
        </rights>
      </lom>
    </metadata>
  </description>
  <manifestation>
    <identifier>
      <catalog>manifestation-cmr-id</catalog>
      <entry>106062</entry>
    </identifier>
    <name>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.manifestationNameValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>experience</value>
    </name>
    <item>
      <location>
        <uri>http://www.oercommons.org/courses/stand-up-and-sing-arts-and-our-reform-history</uri>
      </location>
    </item>
  </manifestation>
</expression>
